# allocateRenderResources()

**Instance Method**

Allocates resources required to render audio.

## Declaration

```swift
func allocateRenderResources() throws
```

## Discussion

- [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] if the operation failed.

## Discussion

Hosts must call this before beginning to render. Subclasses should call the superclass implementation.

This version 3 method is bridged to the version 2 [doc://com.apple.audiotoolbox/documentation/AudioToolbox/AudioUnitInitialize(_:)] API.



## Managing the Render Cycle

- **deallocateRenderResources()**: Deallocates resources required to render audio.
- **reset()**: Resets transitory rendering state to its initial state.
- **renderResourcesAllocated**: Determines whether the audio unit has allocated render resources.
- **renderBlock**: The block that hosts use to ask the audio unit to render audio.
- **scheduleParameterBlock**: The block that hosts use to schedule parameters.
- **maximumFramesToRender**: The maximum number of frames that the audio unit can render at once.
- **token(byAddingRenderObserver:)**: Adds a block to be called on each render cycle.
- **removeRenderObserver(_:)**: Removes an observer block previously added to the render cycle.
- **AURenderObserver**: A block called when an audio unit renders audio.
